reviewText: I remember as a child watching this movie over and over again sitting on the living room floor,looking from the t.v set to the kitchen repeatly and watching my mom spent hours putting up decorations in the kitchen and boxes being all over the place  filled with decorations. Snow slowly falling out side. IT WAS ALMOST CHRISTMAS!!!!  I remember the house smelling so extra clean. We were all so very happy.!  The excitment of xmas,.....everything to look forward too.!  Nothing to worry about in the world except going back to school and the xmas season being over with. My mom was aways doing her very best to make our xmas so wonderful and special for my sister and i. Now that I am in my late 30's, and my mother is now no longer living, I still go back to that time period in my mind and think how very special it was and will always be to me. This movie brings me back too that very moment everytime I think of xmas & or watch this movie.  It holds a very special place in my heart. It teaches/showes us the power of giving and being nice when sometimes people are not nice nor giving in return.  A must see.!
summary: Brought back a lot of wonderful  christmas memory's

reviewText: With all of the crazy holiday movies out there, with lots of violence and even horror, I have to say this is a very clean all in the family classic. So many people love this film because it brings family together. And what is great about the plot, is that all these years Santa has given to kids, but now the tide has turned and the kids now go out to give back to Santa. Its a hart warming Christmas classic. And the ending is great, the acting is good, and while some may say cheesy, I have to say when your a kid growing up, this is believable and a fun movie. Get this if you want to hold on to a true holiday classic that will always be just that, a "Holiday Classic"The Christmas That Almost Wasn't
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pioneer kids tv educator:Paul Tripp makes his leep toThe big screen in this musical Christmas tale that isboth heartwarming,funny and pogient."The Christmast That Almost Wasn't"tells the story ofa mean and vindictive miser:"Phinease T.Prune"(played byromantic singing lead:Rosino Brazzi of "South PacificMovie Fame).Who hates Christmas and Santa so much..thathe buys up the entire North Pole..Including Santa's work-shop and home and raises his rent bill so high!That Santa can't pay the rent and he hires a struggleinglawyer:"Sam Whipple"(Paul Tripp)to help him deal with"Mr.Prune".Seeing that "Prune"will not listen to reason and herefuses to disregard the rent bill."Whipple"gets Santa a job at"Prim's Dept.Store"wherehe listens to the kids'Christmas wishes ,entertains themand helps to sell "Mr.Prim's"(played by another well knownkids tv personality:"Wonderama's","Just For Fun's"and"Let Take A Trip's"Sonny Fox)toys during the holidays.But "Mr.Prune"is not one to be foiled by two goodguys.And he conspires with his manservant:"Bascome"toruin the plans of our heroes.Will he succeed in evicting The Clauses and theirworkers and ruin Christmas for everyone?!The film has a wonderful story and beautiful songsperformed by Mr.Tripp(who also wrote the tunes with Mr.Ray Carter),Mr.Brazzi and the actors playingSanta and Mrs.Claus(Played by Mr.Brazzi's late wife Lida).The sets are dark but charming and the acting is superb.For anyone..who wants a truly charming and tunefulYultide Fantasy?This is the one film to have.
summary: Paul Tripp Saves Christmas in this Musical Yultide Classic!

reviewText: This 1966 import was a perennial in neighborhood theaters first-run, and was so successful that it was picked up by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer for a national reissue. Paul Tripp, a fixture of early children's television, co-wrote the original score and wrote the inventive book. In this period piece set at the turn of the 20th century, the meanest man in the world forecloses on Santa Claus, forcing Santa to come up with the rent by midnight on Christmas Eve. Santa's friend Sam convinces a businessman to hire Santa for his department store, but Santa has stage fright: he's never seen children wide awake! The villain pulls many dirty tricks to achieve his aim, but the children in the town all band together to save Christmas.Rossano Brazzi (of "South Pacific" fame) plays the mustachioed villain, and his makeup and costume will remind movie buffs of Ernie Kovacs or perhaps Jack Lemmon's "Professor Fate." Paul Tripp is Santa's resourceful friend, and Alberto Rabagliati is a wonderful Santa Claus. Rabagliati's performance is all the more impressive because the Italian actor speaks his dialogue in phonetic English. (The entire film was shot without live sound recording, as was often the practice in Italy, and the actors' voices were dubbed in later, including an expressive American actor doubling for Rabagliati.) Director Brazzi cast his wife Lidia as Mrs. Santa Claus, and the supporting cast features veteran comic Mischa Auer as Santa's flustered bookkeeper.The Paul Tripp-Ray Carter songs are pleasantly catchy, and pop singer Glenn Yarbrough sings the title tune. The filmmakers get the most out of a limited budget, and the entire cast works with noticeable enthusiasm. This DVD version is taken from the original Italian edition (IL NATALE CHE QUASI NON FU), so the film is presented with the main and end credits in Italian, although the soundtrack is in English throughout. (The American titles can be found on the VHS release of the 1980s.) Print quality is excellent, with strong color values.Simple enough for kids to follow, and clever enough for their parents to enjoy, this almost-forgotten Christmas movie makes a wonderful holiday show. If you saw it first-run, it loses none of its magic today.
summary: Charming and clever Christmas story, excellent family entertainment
